name: Ant
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613718) or [see the Ant documentation](http://ant.apache.org/)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: antBuildFile
inputs.label: Ant build file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Ant build file.

inputs.name: options
inputs.label: Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide any options to pass to the Ant command line. You can provide your own properties (for example, ***-DmyProperty=myPropertyValue***) and also use built-in variables (for example, ***-DcollectionId=$(system.collectionId)***). Alternatively, the built-in variables are already set as environment variables during the build and can be passed directly (for example, ***-DcollectionIdAsEnvVar=%SYSTEM_COLLECTIONID%***).

inputs.name: targets
inputs.label: Target(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional, space-separated list of targets to build. If not specified, the `default` target will be used. If no `default` target is defined, Ant 1.6.0 and later will build all top-level tasks.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to Azure Pipelines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Ant build to Azure Pipelines. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in Azure Pipelines.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the code coverage tool. For on-premises agent support, refer to the `More Information` link below.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of relative paths from the Ant build file to directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. For example: target/classes,target/testClasses.

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class inclusion/exclusion filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: srcDirectories
inputs.label: Source files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of relative paths from the Ant build file to source code directories. Code coverage reports will use these to highlight source code. For example: src/java,src/Test.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: antHomeUserInputPath
inputs.label: Set ANT_HOME path
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, overrides any existing ANT_HOME environment variable with the given path.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.
